snippet: To Mr. Sanders, political schmoozing is a phony business, but by skipping personal interactions when stumping, especially in early states, he risks failing to connect with undecided voters.
abstract: Bernie Sanders, who has inspired impassioned following during his 2016 presidential run, is unusually averse to personal, one-on-one encounters with voters; Sanders rejects such schmoozing as inauthentic distraction from weightier issues; high-minded, impersonal style carries significant political risk.
lead_paragraph: To Mr. Sanders, political schmoozing is a phony business, but by skipping personal interactions when stumping, especially in early states, he risks failing to connect with undecided voters.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Doesn’t Kiss Babies. That a Problem?
headline.print_headline: Bernie Sanders Won’t Kiss Your Baby. That a Problem?
